intro: Schilleria colubrina, commonly known as the red-flowered schilleria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its striking red petals and slender, branching stems. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Schilleria colubrina is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
